metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26382 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
While the text displayed in Autofill tooltips cannot be directly read by JavaScript, the text was rendered using page fonts. Side-channel attacks on the text by using specially crafted fonts could have lead to this text being inferred by the webpage. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 98.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26382` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
